item.title: Uncertainty and Sample Size
item.description: As a hungry botanist I couldn’t think of a more a-peel-ing metaphor than fruit. Let’s say we have a fruit bowl consisting of strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries…

item.title: Binomial Probability Distribution
item.description: Assume your cat just had a litter of kittens. Con-cat-ulations! However, you suspect you will soon have five different paws gently tapping your face in the morning when you are sleeping…

item.title: Unsupervised Categorical Distribution in JAGS
item.description: Question (1) What methods are necessary to find significant covariates? (2) How do different strata effect our coefficients? (3) Must strata be defined a priori or can we find the stratification of 5 intercept groups within our data set? Simulation To answer our question, we will simulate 1000 plants with 5 different genotypes which will vary by…
